data.title: The Place to Be
data.text: Amendment XXI is the place to relax after a day at the office or in preparations for a night on the town.  It is a place where you will not get lost in the crowd or overcome by TV squawk.  For a sophisticated evening, start or end with Amendment XXI.

data.title: Classy Place
data.text: Great place and perfect location to stop into for a cocktail!  I was very impressed with the number of premium or top shelf brands of alcohol that they carry.   The prices are also VERY reasonable coming from NY.  We had a table inside and it was very comfortable and eventually sat at a table outside and that was nice also, even in the month of July!  I highly recommend Amendment XXI!  If you go, ask Nick to make you one of his speciality drinks!

data.title: Such a HORRIBLE experience...
data.text:
I was told to come here after my cousins wedding, and I was told that it was a nice place that was "chill" and would have a great time...I couldn't be more wrong...

Downstairs, looked like the nice place to be, but upstairs they made it into a dance floor and it gets pretty crowded and have no where to talk. Bartenders were also very rude. I can understand if they were busy, but throwing things at the patrons is UNACCEPTABLE. 

As my family was having a great time, one of my cousins was called out to the hallway and was asked for his information. Apparently he was being accused of stealing....because he was black... I know we were in Alabama, but I didn't think I would witness racial profiling on my trip! Next time I'm in town to visit I'm staying AWAY from this place at all costs. Never. Coming. Again.

data.title: Modern and unfussy
data.text: My kind of place -- sophisticated and classy but not uptight, great classic cocktails and beer selection, flat screens showing the Seahawks game (Ca-CAW!) but with no sound... better sounds coming from Mr. Deejay anyway. :)

data.title: Great place for specialty drinks
data.text: This is our second year to make a visit here while in Huntsville. It's located on the scenic old square. Even in July, sitting outside is quite enjoyable. The drinks are yummy and a lot of fun to try. Go if you have a chance.

data.title: Mixology
data.text: As far as I know this is the only real "mixology" bar in Huntsville.  Most bigger cities have been on the trend for a long time to have really nice cocktail bars where the drinks are not cookie cutter drinks made with mixes, they are made with fresh ingredients and offer unique choices.  Good atmosphere downstairs.  Upstairs, on the other hand, was not a place I want to hang out.

data.title: Best and most inventive drinks in town!
data.text:
Great place to go for drinks and good conversation!  The bartenders are extremely knowledgable and the have come up with some very interesting drink combinations.  Their Margaritas are simply the best anywhere outside San Antonio.  

they have seasonal drinks based on the fruit available or the season (fresh and light in summer and heavier in winter).  Grab a seat outside if the weather is nice or have a nice comfortable seat inside.

data.title: Best Bar In Huntsville
data.text: The title says it all! By far the best bar in Huntsville. Diverse crowd, great bartenders, really good and unique cocktails. Plus, no smoking!

data.title: A weak try at crafted cocktails
data.text: As a fan of crafted cocktails (think 5 ingredient + using rare liquors and homemade complements), I was a bit disappointed here. The drinks are one dimensional, and rather weak (for $12, I'm used to 2-3 oz drinks, but I recognize there may be local restrictions). It's a good try, and maybe with time they will be able to develop some innovative approaches. I'd suggest offering some good shrubs for flavors, adding bitter liqueurs (amaros, herbals, etc.) to build depth, lose the middling brands, and focus on adding some real cocktail choices (rather than margaritas and basics) - educate your customers and take them from teeny drinks to the big leagues. I gave 3 stars for effort because I like the ambiance and they did use real raspberries for one of my selections. I'll try again in hopes of improvements.

data.title: Birthday adventure
data.text: It's unlike other lounges in Huntsville.  It allows clients to feel like they are in a different city, especially if they are a Huntsville native like myself.  Drinks are really good, kind of pricey.  The upstairs area has a dj and a dance floor, which is where my best friend a I spent most of my birthday night.

data.title: tale of two
data.text: when we arrived, the bartender on duty seemed preoccupied with personal things and barely gave us the time of day. he never smiled and had zero personality. the drinks were good, but the service was lacking. mid drink, the next shift bartender came in and he was personality plus! very friendly and engaging. his drinks were good also, but his attitude made it good.

data.title: Great Bar and Cocktails
data.text: Amendment 21 serves very fresh seasonal cocktails.  It is a great atmosphere and you won't find drinks like this anywhere else.  It is a great place to unwind and get a drink.  It is a true cocktail bar and cocktails take center stage, but they do have good wine and beer selections as well.

data.title: Great hangout
data.text: We went on a Tuesday night when nothing is going on downtown.  There just happened to be a jam session going on.  They don't serve food but are more than willing to go to other restaurants around and get whatever you would like.  We ordered desert from the commons kitchen and many got pizza from next door.

data.title: A Bar with Dual Personalities
data.text: Friday night at Amendment proved to be one of the most interesting spots to people watch since it was pretty packed inside and out.  Cocktails were inventive though expensive at $12 but no mixers so the fresh fruit made a difference.  There is no draft but the bottled beer selection was nice and varied.  The ground level of this bar is reminiscent of a plush Starbucks…big sofas, high tables with chairs and the bar of course.  Lighting was pretty bright for a bar.  Upstairs was darker and a DJ was spinning.  Dress code varied from guys in cargo shorts, tshirts, and flip flops to women in red satin dresses and 5 inch heels.  The crowd was a mixed bag but the bar is solid.
